data.title: Buffet Palace - Feb 2016
data.text: We (the wife and I) had been to this Oriental Buffet place in the past and it was very good and very reasonable for just two people - During this visit we were somewhat disappointed by the large jump in price and no apparent change in food selection or increase in food quality

data.title: Average Chinese Buffet Food; Better Buffet's Out There!
data.text:
My family and I decided to try this new restaurant after not going to a buffet in over a year and chose this place as it was on our way home.

The restaurant is quite large, one of the larger one's we have ever been too, it's clean inside, lot's of seating available, they have a sushi buffet, a mongolian buffet and your normal run of the mill Chinese buffet with soups, main courses and deserts.

Not too impressed with the food buffet to be honest, we have found more variety at other places, plus the food here was just okay, it wasn't as flavorful as other places we have been too before.

on the flip side, for lunch, we paid $7.99 for adult and $3.99 for kids, so I suppose you get what you pay for.

We might give it another shot in the near future to see whether the food has improved or not.

data.title: AWFUL! Please Please take your hard earned money somewhere else.
data.text: Positive: I did enjoy the one piece of fresh pineapple I ate. This is the worst place I have ever tried to eat.  The food tasted as if it had been reheated and/or left out all day.  The fried rice had goya beans in it.  I tried to eat the mushrooms, orange chicken, sweet and sour chicken.  ALL was awful.  the only salad dressing offered at the salad bar was Italian.  Even the kiwi was so hard it couldn't be eaten.    When it came time to leave, about 15 minutes after arrival I went to the desk and advised that I was not paying for that horrible food.  The lady behind the counter said "And don't ever come back!". Please please save your money and go somewhere else.

data.title: It's My New Favorite for Chinese!!
data.text: Let's face it, when it comes to Chinese buffets, it's hard to find a good one these days.  Most leave you disappointed and wishing you'd gone somewhere else.  However, I was very pleased with Buffet Palace. It was around 5:30p on a Sunday when we arrived and throughout our dinner they restocked the buffet. There was never an empty or overly heated dish.  They have a large variety of selections to choose from, including the sushi bar.  My only complaint was the Hot and Sour soup being too thick, which seems to happen at most buffets. Otherwise, we had a great experience here and will choose this location over any other every time we want Chinese.

data.title: Good food, lacking staff
data.text: Food was good, after waiting for grill chef. Waitress kept rushing us to leave, hovering. Finally just left, and she was angry we only left minimal tip as she not only did nothing but kept pushing us out. While I do enjoy the food, not sure we'll return

data.title: A Place Sure to Please Everyone!
data.text: This is a great local place to dine, and every one is sure to find something to please them.  They offer Mongolian Grill, and Sushi, as well as a very large buffet.  Prices are average for today's economy, and of course on Friday and Saturday nights you pay a bit more (Approximately $11. 39 for adults) with all of the seafood choices added to the menu.  Last night they had several selections of Prawns, Frog Legs, Salmon, Crawdads, and clams on the half shell. They have lots of varieties to choose from, like 5 different soups, I just can't bring myself to choose something besides Egg-drop.  They have several hot bars, and a great selection of fresh fruits and salads, and then the normal sweet treats and ice cream.  As always our waitress last night was wonderful, she was great at keeping the glasses full, and the table cleared of dirty dishes.  My son gets the Mongolian Grill every time, he is partial to this when ever we go out to dine for Chinese, he say's that theirs is very tasty.  Why wouldn't it be, you design it any way you want it to suit your taste buds.  The man in my life is partial to their salmon with a sauce on top, and I myself like the Coconut Shrimp dish.  Fresh food is brought out and added to the bar constantly.  They serve different things from lunch and dinner, but I did request Egg Foo Young one night, and they were happy to oblige.  That is only on the lunch menu apparently.  Over all this is a great place to dine.  I have been there with our granddaughters, just the two of us, or with adult friends and family.  Every one always seem to have a good time and enjoy their meal.
